member.remarks: See the Orgs API documentation for more information.

member.name: M:Octokit.IOrganizationMembersClient.GetAll(System.String)

summary.para: List all users who are members of an organization. A member is a user that belongs to at least 1 team in the organization.
If the authenticated user is also an owner of this organization then both concealed and public member will be returned.
If the requester is not an owner of the organization the query will be redirected to the public members list.

member.remarks: See the API documentation for more information.

member.name: M:Octokit.OrganizationMembersClient.GetAll(System.String)

summary.para: List all users who are members of an organization. A member is a user that belongs to at least 1 team in the organization.
If the authenticated user is also an owner of this organization then both concealed and public member will be returned.
If the requester is not an owner of the organization the query will be redirected to the public members list.

member.remarks: See the API documentation for more information.

If the authenticated user is also an owner of this organization then both concealed and public member will be returned.
If the requester is not an owner of the organization the query will be redirected to the public members list.

member.remarks: See the API documentation for more information.
member.param: The role filter to use when getting the users,

member.name: T:Octokit.AuthorizationExtensions
member.summary: Represents operations to simplify triggering the authorization flow

member.name: M:Octokit.AuthorizationExtensions.GetOrCreateApplicationAuthentication(Octokit.IAuthorizationsClient,System.String,System.String,Octokit.NewAuthorization,System.Func{Octokit.TwoFactorRequiredException,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{Octokit.TwoFactorChallengeResult}})
member.summary: This method will create a new authorization for the specified OAuth application, only if an authorization for that application doesn’t already exist for the user. It returns the user’s token for the application if one exists. Otherwise, it creates a new one.

remarks.para: This method allows the caller to provide a callback which is used to retrieve the two-factor code from the user. Typically the callback is used to show some user interface to the user.
See API documentation for more details.

member.param: Client ID for the OAuth application that is requesting the token
Defines the scopes and metadata for the token
Callback used to retrieve the two-factor authentication code from the user

member.name: T:Octokit.RateLimitExceededException
member.summary: Exception thrown when GitHub API Rate limits are exceeded.

summary.para: For requests using Basic Authentication or OAuth, you can make up to 5,000 requests per hour. For unauthenticated requests, the rate limit allows you to make up to 60 requests per hour.
See http://developer.github.com/v3/#rate-limiting for more details.

member.name: M:Octokit.ApiConnection.GetQueuedOperation``1(System.Uri,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Executes a GET to the API object at the specified URI. This operation is appropriate for API calls which queue long running calculations and return a collection of a resource. A token used to cancel this potentially long running request

member.summary: Create a new commit which has multiple parents (i.e. a merge commit)
member.param: The message to associate with the commit
The tree associated with the commit

The SHAs of the commits that were the parents of this commit. If empty, the commit will be written as a root commit. For a single parent, an array of one SHA should be provided; for a merge commit, an array of more than one should be provided.

member.name: T:Octokit.NewRepositoryHook
member.summary: Creates a Webhook for the repository.
member.remarks:
To create a webhook, the following fields are required by the config:
url A required string defining the URL to which the payloads will be delivered.
content_type
An optional string defining the media type used to serialize the payloads. Supported values include json and form. The default is form.
secret
An optional string that’s passed with the HTTP requests as an X-Hub-Signature header. The value of this header is computed as the HMAC hex digest of the body, using the secret as the key.
insecure_ssl:
An optional string that determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for url will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include "0" (verification is performed) and "1" (verification is not performed). The default is "0".
API: https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/hooks/#create-a-hook

member.name: M:Octokit.NewRepositoryHook.#ctor(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Use "web" for a webhook or use the name of a valid service. (See https://api.github.com/hooks for the list of valid service names.)

Key/value pairs to provide settings for this hook. These settings vary between the services and are defined in the github-services repository. Booleans are stored internally as “1” for true, and “0” for false. Any JSON true/false values will be converted automatically.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewRepositoryHook.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the hook to create. Use "web" for a webhook or use the name of a valid service. (See https://api.github.com/hooks for the list of valid service names.)

member.name: P:Octokit.NewRepositoryHook.Config
member.summary: Key/value pairs to provide settings for this hook. These settings vary between the services and are defined in the github-services repository. Booleans are stored internally as “1” for true, and “0” for false. Any JSON true/false values will be converted automatically.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewRepositoryHook.Events
member.summary: Determines what events the hook is triggered for. Default: ["push"]

member.name: P:Octokit.NewRepositoryHook.Active
member.summary: Determines whether the hook is actually triggered on pushes.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewSubscription.Subscribed
member.summary: Determines if notifications should be received from this repository.
member.remarks: If you would like to watch a repository, set subscribed to true. If you would like to ignore notifications made within a repository, set ignored to true. If you would like to stop watching a repository, delete the repository’s subscription completely using the method.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewSubscription.Ignored
member.summary: Determines if all notifications should be blocked from this repository.

member.name: T:Octokit.NewTag
member.summary: Used to create a new tag
member.remarks: Note that creating a tag object does not create the reference that makes a tag in Git. If you want to create an annotated tag in Git, you have to do this call to create the tag object, and then create the refs/tags/[tag] reference. If you want to create a lightweight tag, you only have to create the tag reference - this call would be unnecessary.

member.name: T:Octokit.NewMerge
member.summary: Used to merge branches in a repository.

remarks.para: The Repo Merging API supports merging branches in a repository. This accomplishes essentially the same thing as merging one branch into another in a local repository and then pushing to GitHub. The benefit is that the merge is done on the server side and a local repository is not needed. This makes it more appropriate for automation and other tools where maintaining local repositories would be cumbersome and inefficient.

member.name: M:Octokit.NewMerge.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a new commit which has multiple parents (i.e. a merge commit)
member.param: The name of the base branch that the head will be merged into
The head to merge. This can be a branch name or a commit SHA1.

member.summary: The name of the base branch that the head will be merged into (REQUIRED).

member.summary: The head to merge. This can be a branch name or a commit SHA1 (REQUIRED).

member.name: T:Octokit.SimpleJson
member.summary:
This class encodes and decodes JSON strings. Spec. details, see http://www.json.org/
JSON uses Arrays and Objects. These correspond here to the datatypes JsonArray(IList<object>) and JsonObject(IDictionary<string,object>). All numbers are parsed to doubles.

member.name: P:Octokit.GitHubCommit.Author
member.summary: Gets the GitHub account information for the commit author. It attempts to match the email address used in the commit with the email addresses registered with the GitHub account. If no account corresponds to the commit email, then this property is null.

member.name: P:Octokit.GitHubCommit.Committer
member.summary: Gets the GitHub account information for the commit committer. It attempts to match the email address used in the commit with the email addresses registered with the GitHub account. If no account corresponds to the commit email, then this property is null.

member.name: T:Octokit.IOauthClient
member.summary: Provides methods used in the OAuth web flow.

member.name: M:Octokit.IOauthClient.GetGitHubLoginUrl(Octokit.OauthLoginRequest)
member.summary: Gets the URL used in the first step of the web flow. The Web application should redirect to this URL.
member.param: Parameters to the Oauth web flow login url

member.name: M:Octokit.IOauthClient.CreateAccessToken(Octokit.OauthTokenRequest)
member.summary: Makes a request to get an access token using the code returned when GitHub.com redirects back from the URL GitHub login url to the application.
member.remarks: If the user accepts your request, GitHub redirects back to your site with a temporary code in a code parameter as well as the state you provided in the previous step in a state parameter. If the states don’t match, the request has been created by a third party and the process should be aborted. Exchange this for an access token using this method.

member.name: T:Octokit.OauthClient
member.summary: Provides methods used in the OAuth web flow.

member.name: M:Octokit.OauthClient.#ctor(Octokit.IConnection)
member.summary: Create an instance of the OauthClient

member.name: M:Octokit.OauthClient.GetGitHubLoginUrl(Octokit.OauthLoginRequest)
member.summary: Gets the URL used in the first step of the web flow. The Web application should redirect to this URL.
member.param: Parameters to the Oauth web flow login url

member.name: M:Octokit.OauthClient.CreateAccessToken(Octokit.OauthTokenRequest)
member.summary: Makes a request to get an access token using the code returned when GitHub.com redirects back from the URL GitHub login url to the application.
member.remarks: If the user accepts your request, GitHub redirects back to your site with a temporary code in a code parameter as well as the state you provided in the previous step in a state parameter. If the states don’t match, the request has been created by a third party and the process should be aborted. Exchange this for an access token using this method.

member.name: T:Octokit.OauthLoginRequest
member.summary: Used to initiate an OAuth2 authentication flow from 3rd party web sites.

member.name: M:Octokit.OauthLoginRequest.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the OAuth login request with the required parameter.
member.param: The client ID you received from GitHub when you registered the application.

member.name: P:Octokit.OauthLoginRequest.ClientId
member.summary: The client ID you received from GitHub when you registered the application.

member.name: P:Octokit.OauthLoginRequest.RedirectUri
member.summary: The URL in your app where users will be sent after authorization.
member.remarks: See the documentation about redirect urls for more information.

member.name: P:Octokit.OauthLoginRequest.Scopes
member.summary: A set of scopes to request. If not provided, scope defaults to an empty list of scopes for users that don’t have a valid token for the app. For users who do already have a valid token for the app, the user won’t be shown the OAuth authorization page with the list of scopes. Instead, this step of the flow will automatically complete with the same scopes that were used last time the user completed the flow.
member.remarks: See the scopes documentation for more information about scopes.

member.name: P:Octokit.OauthLoginRequest.State
member.summary: An unguessable random string. It is used to protect against cross-site request forgery attacks. In ASP.NET MVC this would correspond to an anti-forgery token.

member.name: T:Octokit.OauthTokenRequest
member.summary: Used to create an Oauth login request.

The client secret you received from GitHub when you registered.
The code you received as a response to making the OAuth login request

member.summary: The client ID you received from GitHub when you registered the application.

member.summary: The client secret you received from GitHub when you registered.

member.name: P:Octokit.OauthTokenRequest.Code
member.summary: The code you received as a response to making the OAuth login request.

member.summary: The URL in your app where users will be sent after authorization.

member.name: M:Octokit.IRepositoryContentsClient.GetArchiveLink(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method will return a 302 to a URL to download a tarball or zipball archive for a repository. Please make sure your HTTP framework is configured to follow redirects or you will need to use the Location header to make a second GET request. Note: For private repositories, these links are temporary and expire quickly.

Please make sure your HTTP framework is configured to follow redirects or you will need to use the Location header to make a second GET request. Note: For private repositories, these links are temporary and expire quickly.
member.remarks: https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/contents/#get-archive-link

member.name: M:Octokit.RepositoryContentsClient.GetArchive(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get an archive of a given repository's contents
member.remarks: https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/contents/#get-archive-link
member.returns: The binary contents of the archive

member.name: T:Octokit.ReleaseAssetUpload
member.summary: Used to upload a release asset.
member.remarks: This endpoint makes use of a Hypermedia relation to determine which URL to access. This endpoint is provided by a URI template in the release’s API response. You need to use an HTTP client which supports SNI to make calls to this endpoint. The asset data is expected in its raw binary form, rather than JSON. Everything else about the endpoint is the same as the rest of the API. For example, you’ll still need to pass your authentication to be able to upload an asset.

member.name: T:Octokit.NewRepositoryWebHook
member.summary: Creates a Webhook for the repository.
member.remarks:
To create a webhook, the following fields are required by the config:
url A required string defining the URL to which the payloads will be delivered.
content_type
An optional string defining the media type used to serialize the payloads. Supported values include json and form. The default is form.
secret
An optional string that’s passed with the HTTP requests as an X-Hub-Signature header. The value of this header is computed as the HMAC hex digest of the body, using the secret as the key.
insecure_ssl:
An optional string that determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for url will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include "0" (verification is performed) and "1" (verification is not performed). The default is "0".
API: https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/hooks/#create-a-hook

member.name: M:Octokit.NewRepositoryWebHook.#ctor(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Using default values for ContentType, Secret and InsecureSsl.
member.param: Use "web" for a webhook or use the name of a valid service. (See https://api.github.com/hooks for the list of valid service names.)

Key/value pairs to provide settings for this hook. These settings vary between the services and are defined in the github-services repository. Booleans are stored internally as “1” for true, and “0” for false. Any true/false values will be converted automatically.
A required string defining the URL to which the payloads will be delivered.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewRepositoryWebHook.Url
member.summary: Gets the URL of the hook to create.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewRepositoryWebHook.ContentType
member.summary: Gets the content type used to serialize the payload. The default is `form`.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewRepositoryWebHook.Secret
member.summary: Gets the secret used as the key for the HMAC hex digest of the body passed with the HTTP requests as an X-Hub-Signature header.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewRepositoryWebHook.InsecureSsl
member.summary: Gets whether the SSL certificate of the host will be verified when delivering payloads. The default is `false`.
member.value: true if SSL certificate verification is not performed; otherwise, false.

member.summary: The supported content types for payload serialization.
